item.title: hugo-simpledoc-theme
item.description: Hugo Simpledoc Theme is a simple and clean documentation theme for Hugo. Also you may use it for building a FAQ-page or generating an online book (why not?). This theme is a very-slightly-modified Hugo port of great WPThemeDoc. Screenshot Features Original Clean design One page Responsive Easely customizable Added Hugo! Demo You see it in action here and now!

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation Install Hugo and create a new site. Install hugo simpledoc theme. Inside your new Hugo project run: $ cd themes $ git clone https://github.com/aerohub/hugo-simpledoc-theme Then take a look inside the exampleSite folder of this theme. You’ll find a file called config.toml and a folder archetypes. Copy them into the root folder of your Hugo site. Configuration Open just-copied config.toml and fill it with your data.

item.title: Writing Documentation
item.description: OK, all you need is just write! Run in the root of your project: hugo new my-first-doc-item.md Then open the file with your favorite text editor and you will see something like this: --- title: "My First Doc Item" date: 2017-12-12T00:57:40+03:00 anchor: "my-first-doc-item" weight: --- Write your doc chapter and give it a weight. You may organize your content as you like (even with folders) but All the docs are ranged by weight here!

item.title: Serving and Building
item.description: Test your site In order to see your site in action, run Hugo’s built-in local server. $ hugo server -w Now enter localhost:1313 in the address bar of your browser. Build your site Just run $ hugo You’ll find your documentation files in public folder in the root of Hugo project.

item.title: Credits and Thanks
item.description: Many thanks go to: spf13 & Hugo Rich Tabor & original WPThemeDoc

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
